spaces.name: Personal Space
spaces.description: Your private workspace for personal notes, ideas, and drafts

files.title: Welcome to Your Personal Space
files.content:
# Welcome to Your Personal Space

This is your private workspace where you can:

- üìù Create personal notes and documentation
- üí° Capture ideas and brainstorm
- üìã Draft documents before sharing
- üîí Keep private information secure

## Quick Start

1. Click "New Document" to create your first page
2. Use markdown for rich formatting
3. Organize with tags and folders
4. Search across all your documents

## Tips

- Use tags like #todo, #idea, #important to organize
- Create folder structures that match your workflow
- Link between documents for better navigation

Happy documenting! üöÄ

files.title: Markdown Quick Reference
files.content:
# Markdown Quick Reference

A quick guide to markdown formatting in your wiki.

## Headers

```
# H1 Header
## H2 Header
### H3 Header
```

## Text Formatting

- **Bold text**: `**bold**`
- *Italic text*: `*italic*`
- ~~Strikethrough~~: `~~strikethrough~~`
- `Code`: `` `code` ``

## Lists

### Unordered Lists
```
- Item 1
- Item 2
  - Nested item
```

### Ordered Lists
```
1. First item
2. Second item
3. Third item
```

## Links and Images

- Link: `[Link Text](https://example.com)`
- Image: `![Alt Text](image-url.jpg)`

## Code Blocks

\`\`\`javascript
const example = "code block";
\`\`\`

## Tables

```
| Column 1 | Column 2 |
|----------|----------|
| Data 1   | Data 2   |
```

## Blockquotes

```
> This is a quote
```

spaces.name: Shared Space
spaces.description: Collaborative workspace for team documentation and knowledge sharing

files.title: Collaboration Guidelines
files.content:
# Collaboration Guidelines

Welcome to the team's shared workspace!

## Purpose

This space is designed for:
- üìö Team documentation
- ü§ù Collaborative projects
- üí¨ Knowledge sharing
- üìä Process documentation

## Best Practices

### Creating Documents
1. Use clear, descriptive titles
2. Add relevant tags for discoverability
3. Include creation date and author
4. Keep documents focused on a single topic

### Editing Documents
1. Check if anyone else is editing
2. Make incremental changes
3. Add meaningful update notes
4. Preserve existing formatting

### Organization
- Use consistent folder structure
- Tag documents appropriately
- Archive outdated content
- Link related documents

## Document Types

- **Meeting Notes**: Use the meeting notes template
- **Process Docs**: Step-by-step procedures
- **Guides**: How-to and reference materials
- **Projects**: Project documentation and planning

## Tips

- Search before creating to avoid duplicates
- Use tags like #important, #draft, #archived
- Update the table of contents regularly
- Keep formatting consistent across documents

files.title: Team Onboarding Checklist
files.content:
# Team Onboarding Checklist

Welcome to the team! Complete these items during your first week.

## Day 1

- [ ] Review team collaboration guidelines
- [ ] Set up development environment
- [ ] Get access to necessary tools and platforms
- [ ] Meet the team
- [ ] Review current projects

## First Week

- [ ] Complete system orientation
- [ ] Shadow team members
- [ ] Review key documentation
- [ ] Attend team meetings
- [ ] Set up wiki account and personal space
- [ ] Complete first small task

## Resources

- [Team Guidelines](collaboration-guidelines.md)
- Development Setup Guide
- Communication Channels
- Project Overview

## Questions?

Reach out to your onboarding buddy or team lead!

spaces.name: Read-Only Space
spaces.description: Reference materials, policies, and official documentation

files.title: Documentation Policy
files.content:
# Documentation Policy

**Effective Date**: January 2025
**Version**: 1.0

## Purpose

This policy establishes standards for creating and maintaining documentation within the organization.

## Scope

Applies to all team members creating or maintaining documentation in the wiki system.

## Standards

### Document Quality
1. **Accuracy**: All information must be verified and accurate
2. **Clarity**: Use clear, concise language
3. **Completeness**: Cover all relevant aspects of the topic
4. **Currency**: Keep documents up-to-date

### Document Structure
1. Clear title and purpose statement
2. Table of contents for long documents
3. Logical section organization
4. Consistent formatting
5. Proper use of headers and lists

### Maintenance
1. Review documents quarterly
2. Update as processes change
3. Archive outdated content
4. Maintain version history

## Document Types

### Policies
- Official organizational policies
- Must be approved before publication
- Stored in Read-Only Space

### Procedures
- Step-by-step instructions
- Include screenshots where helpful
- Regularly tested and updated

### Reference Materials
- Technical specifications
- API documentation
- System architecture

### Guides
- How-to documentation
- Best practices
- Training materials

## Approval Process

1. Draft in personal or shared space
2. Review by subject matter experts
3. Approval by designated authority
4. Publication to appropriate space

## Compliance

Non-compliance with this policy may result in documentation being revised or removed.

## Questions

Contact the documentation team lead for clarification.

files.title: Wiki User Guide
files.content:
# Wiki User Guide

Complete guide to using the NooblyJS Wiki Application.

## Table of Contents

1. [Getting Started](#getting-started)
2. [Creating Documents](#creating-documents)
3. [Organizing Content](#organizing-content)
4. [Searching](#searching)
5. [Spaces](#spaces)

## Getting Started

### Logging In
1. Navigate to the wiki homepage
2. Click "Sign In"
3. Authenticate with your credentials

### Dashboard Overview
- **Recent Documents**: Your recently accessed pages
- **Spaces**: Available workspaces
- **Search**: Find documents across all spaces
- **Quick Actions**: Create new documents, browse folders

## Creating Documents

### New Document
1. Click "New Document" button
2. Enter title and select space
3. Add tags for organization
4. Write content using Markdown
5. Click "Save"

### Markdown Support
The wiki supports full Markdown formatting:
- Headers, lists, and text formatting
- Links and images
- Code blocks and syntax highlighting
- Tables and blockquotes

See the [Markdown Quick Reference](markdown-guide.md) for details.

## Organizing Content

### Using Tags
- Add multiple tags separated by commas
- Use consistent tag names
- Common tags: #important, #draft, #review, #template

### Folder Structure
- Documents are organized into folders within spaces
- Create logical folder hierarchies
- Use descriptive folder names

## Searching

### Basic Search
1. Enter search terms in the search bar
2. Results show matching documents
3. Click to view full document

### Advanced Search
- Search in specific spaces
- Filter by tags
- Search within date ranges

## Spaces

### Personal Space
- Private workspace
- Visible only to you
- Full read-write access

### Shared Space
- Team collaboration
- Visible to all team members
- Full read-write access

### Read-Only Space
- Official documentation
- Visible to all
- Read-only access
- Content managed by administrators

## Tips and Best Practices

1. **Use Templates**: Start with templates for consistency
2. **Tag Everything**: Makes searching easier
3. **Link Documents**: Create connections between related content
4. **Regular Reviews**: Keep content current
5. **Clear Titles**: Use descriptive, searchable titles

## Support

For help or questions, contact your system administrator.

files.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
files.content:
# Keyboard Shortcuts

Speed up your workflow with these keyboard shortcuts.

## Navigation

| Shortcut | Action |
|----------|--------|
| `Ctrl/Cmd + K` | Quick search |
| `Ctrl/Cmd + N` | New document |
| `Ctrl/Cmd + /` | Toggle sidebar |
| `Ctrl/Cmd + B` | Browse spaces |

## Editing

| Shortcut | Action |
|----------|--------|
| `Ctrl/Cmd + S` | Save document |
| `Ctrl/Cmd + E` | Edit mode |
| `Ctrl/Cmd + P` | Preview mode |
| `Esc` | Cancel edit |

## Formatting

| Shortcut | Action |
|----------|--------|
| `Ctrl/Cmd + B` | Bold text |
| `Ctrl/Cmd + I` | Italic text |
| `Ctrl/Cmd + K` | Insert link |
| `Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + C` | Code block |

## Document Management

| Shortcut | Action |
|----------|--------|
| `Ctrl/Cmd + D` | Duplicate |
| `Ctrl/Cmd + Delete` | Delete document |
| `Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + T` | Add tags |

*Note: Use Cmd on Mac, Ctrl on Windows/Linux*

files.title: Standard Document Templates
files.content:
# Standard Document Templates

Use these templates to maintain consistency across documentation.

## Available Templates

### 1. Project Documentation Template
For documenting projects and initiatives.
- Overview and goals
- Timeline and milestones
- Resources and stakeholders
- Status tracking

### 2. Meeting Notes Template
For recording meeting discussions and decisions.
- Attendees and agenda
- Discussion points
- Action items
- Next steps

### 3. Process Documentation Template
For step-by-step procedures.
- Purpose and scope
- Prerequisites
- Detailed steps
- Troubleshooting

### 4. Technical Specification Template
For technical documentation.
- Requirements
- Architecture
- Implementation details
- Testing criteria

### 5. How-To Guide Template
For instructional content.
- Objective
- Required knowledge
- Step-by-step instructions
- Examples and screenshots

## Using Templates

1. Copy the template content
2. Create a new document
3. Paste and customize
4. Fill in all sections
5. Remove unused sections

## Custom Templates

Teams can create custom templates in the Shared Space for specialized needs.
